context: A potential security incident involving a possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was detected, wherein an attacker might be trying to gain access to Azure AD authentication tokens on host `vnevado-win11t`. The process involved had the ProcessId__CreatedTimeUtc__CommandLine `7036__2024-06-20t09:29:49.304018z__'browsercore.exe'`. This incident might be related to malicious activities associated with accessing critical resources for lateral movement or credential theft.
question: During this incident, it was found that malware was detected and active. Can you identify the file name of the malware that was found to be active?
solution_steps: There was a possible attempt to access Primary Refresh Token (PRT) using the file `browsercore.exe`.
The attempt to access Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was detected from the IP address `107.224.99.179`.
An unknown malware with the file name `mimilib.dll` was detected and was active.
